init-param.description: Path to the data directory. The data directory must contain a "TDB" directory (triple store) and an "index" directory (indexed data).
Comma-separated list of languages (ISO 2-letter codes) supported by this SWS
Minimum length of search keywords. Search requests with keywords that are shorter than this will result in an exception. Default value is 2.

Default method for setting the roots of concept hierarchies for the GetConceptHierarchy method. Supported values are: - topConcepts: only concepts asserted as top concepts of the target concept scheme are considered as roots, - broadestConcept: only the broadest concepts are considered as roots, - both: both top and broadest concepts are considered as roots.

Default relationship type used to build concept hierarchies by the GetConceptHierarchy operation. Supported values are: - narrower: For a parent concept, only concepts that are asserted to be narrower than this one, using skos:narrower, are considered as child concepts, - directNarrower: For a parent concept, only concepts that are immediately narrower than this one using skos:narrowerTransitive are considered as child concepts, - bothNarrower: both narrower and direct narrower relationships are considered in building a concept hierarchy.
Default output format. The supported output formats are application/xml and application/json.

Required filtering type for the GetConcepts and GetConceptHierarchy operations. Possible values are: - none: No filtering is required, this means that a client may request the full list of concepts or the hierarchy of all the concepts in this SWS. This is not recommended for large thesauri. - cs: Concept requests must include at least filter by concept scheme - collection: Concept requests must include a filter by collection - csOrCollection: Concept requests must include a filter by concept scheme or collection - csAndCollection: Concept requests must include a filter by concept scheme or collection
